The simulation can be started by pressing the play button in the centre of the taskbar. It might take a couple of seconds for the simulation to get calculated. As the simulation plays, the daily SO2 deposition is shown for each day using the data from the year of 2019. To the left, there is a toggle for the wind overlay - the wind overlay shows the average wind direction and speed in that day, and has a direct correlation to the SO2 deposition. To the right, there is a toggle for the accumulative deposition - it shows the total SO2 accumulated from all of the simulated days. There are also 4 sliders to adjust. You can adjust, starting from the left: 1) The maximum value of the heatmap - what value of SO2 accumulation should be red (0.5 - 70) 2) The scrubbing efficiency of the SO2 in the factory (0-100%) 3) The resolution of data points, how many data points are calculated (1000 - 20000) 4) The lower bound of the heatmap (0.01-0.1)
